question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: starting_version] [Data loss] Does starting_version at lines 46-47 'not delete any database contents, just transactions as it reprocesses them' guarantee data consistency, or can reprocessing corrupt existing indexed data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: skip_migrations] [Schema mismatch] Can setting skip_migrations to true at line 174 cause the indexer to operate with an incompatible database schema, leading to crashes or data corruption when accessing mismatched tables? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: skip_migrations] [Privilege escalation] Can an attacker exploit skip_migrations=true to prevent security-critical schema updates from being applied, maintaining vulnerable database structures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: ans_contract_address] [Address validation] Does ans_contract_address validation at lines 83-85 check for valid Aptos address format, or can malformed addresses cause parsing errors when the indexer queries the ANS contract? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: ans_contract_address] [Contract impersonation] Can an attacker provide a malicious contract address for ans_contract_address that mimics the ANS contract interface but returns fraudulent name resolution data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: nft_points_contract] [Contract manipulation] Can an attacker specify a malicious nft_points_contract address at lines 87-89 that returns fake NFT point data, manipulating indexed NFT scores or rankings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: ans_contract_address] [Null dereference] Does the comment 'If null, disable ANS indexing' at line 84 properly handle None values, or can null address processing cause panics in address parsing code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerConfig] [Deserialization attack] Can the deny_unknown_fields attribute at line 26 be bypassed by providing known fields with unexpected types, causing deserialization to succeed with corrupted data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerConfig] [Default bypass] Can the serde default attribute at line 30 for the enabled field be exploited to force enabled=true even when explicitly set to false in config files? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Attribute: skip_serializing_if] [Information leak] Do all skip_serializing_if attributes at lines 35, 40, 45, etc. properly prevent None values from being serialized, or can they leak configuration structure information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: fmt()] [URL parsing] Can the url::Url::parse() call at line 95 be exploited with specially crafted postgres URIs that cause panics, buffer overflows, or unexpected behavior in the URL parser? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: fmt()] [Password masking bypass] Does the password masking logic at lines 96-98 handle edge cases like empty passwords, special characters in passwords, or multiple @ symbols in the URI? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: fmt()] [Panic exploitation] Can an attacker provide invalid postgres_uri formats that trigger the expect() panic at line 95, crashing the node during config logging or debugging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Trait: ConfigOptimizer] [Mutable reference] Does the mutable reference to node_config at line 121 in optimize() create race conditions if multiple threads call this function simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Atomicity violation] Are the multiple config field updates at lines 138-196 atomic, or can a crash mid-update leave the indexer in a partially configured invalid state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_FETCH_TASKS] [Resource allocation] Is DEFAULT_FETCH_TASKS=5 at line 21 appropriate for all node types, or can this default cause resource exhaustion on validator nodes running indexers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_TASKS] [Thread limit] Can DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_TASKS=5 at line 22 be insufficient for high-throughput scenarios, causing indexing lag and consensus delays if validators rely on indexed data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_EMIT_EVERY] [Logging overhead] Can DEFAULT_EMIT_EVERY=1000 at line 23 cause excessive logging in high-throughput scenarios, filling disk space and degrading performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Default override] Does the comment at lines 132-135 about 'not overriding configs if specified in local node config file' actually prevent overrides, or do environment variables always take precedence? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Silent failure] Does optimize() return Ok(false) at line 129 when indexer is disabled, potentially masking configuration errors that should be reported to operators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: env_var_or_default()] [Error propagation] Can parsing errors in env_var_or_default() at line 218 be silently swallowed by returning None, hiding misconfigurations until runtime failures occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Warning suppression] Does the warn!() call at lines 163-168 for invalid STARTING_VERSION get logged at appropriate severity, or can attackers hide configuration manipulation by flooding logs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Processor fallback] Can the or_else fallback to 'default_processor' at line 153 mask intentional processor=None configurations, forcing unwanted processing to occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Gap lookback] Can the default gap_lookback_versions of 1,500,000 at line 194 be too large for networks with rapid state growth, causing the gap detection to scan excessive history and slow down? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: default_if_zero()] [Zero handling] Does default_if_zero() at lines 203-208 properly distinguish between explicit zero values (Some(0)) and missing values (None), or does it incorrectly apply defaults? (Low)
